post.description:
Sent when a new checkout is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a checkout is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a new order is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Full

Sent when a new subscription is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Full

Sent when a new subscription is updated. This event fires if the subscription is cancelled, both immediately and if the subscription is cancelled at the end of the current period.

**Discord & Slack support:** On cancellation

Sent when a new product is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a product is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a new pledge is created. Note that this does mean that the pledge has been paid yet.

**Discord & Slack support:** Full

Sent when a pledge is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a new donation is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Full

Sent when a organization is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a new benefit is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a benefit is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a new benefit grant is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a new benefit grant is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

Sent when a new benefit grant is revoked.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Last modification timestamp of the object.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: The dimensions (width, height) in pixels of the advertisement images.

AppPermissionsType.title: AppPermissionsType
AppPermissionsType.description:
App Permissions

The permissions granted to the user access token.

Examples:
    {'contents': 'read', 'issues': 'read', 'deployments': 'write', 'single_file':
'read'}

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: Slug of the article to be used in URLs. If no slug is provided one will be generated from the title.

body.title: Body
body.description: Body in string format. Either one of body or body_base64 is required.

body_base64.title: Body Base64
body_base64.description: Body in base64-encoded format. Can be helpful to bypass Web Application Firewalls (WAF). Either one of body or body_base64 is required.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The ID of the organization owning the article. **Required unless you use an organization token.**

byline.description: If the user or organization should be credited in the byline.

paid_subscribers_only.title: Paid Subscribers Only
paid_subscribers_only.description: Set to true to only make this article available for subscribers to a paid subscription tier in the organization.

paid_subscribers_only_ends_at.title: Paid Subscribers Only Ends At
paid_subscribers_only_ends_at.description: If specified, time at which the article should no longer be restricted to paid subscribers. Only relevant if `paid_subscribers_only` is true.

published_at.title: Published At
published_at.description: Time of publishing. If this date is in the future, the post will be scheduled to publish at this time. If visibility is 'public', published_at will default to the current time.

notify_subscribers.title: Notify Subscribers
notify_subscribers.description: Set to true to deliver this article via email and/or notifications to subscribers.

is_pinned.title: Is Pinned
is_pinned.description: If the article should be pinned

email.title: Email
email.description: Email address to send the preview to. The user must be registered on Polar.

body.title: Body
body.description: Body in string format. body and body_base64 are mutually exclusive.

body_base64.title: Body Base64
body_base64.description: Body in base64-encoded format. Can be helpful to bypass Web Application Firewalls (WAF). body and body_base64 are mutually exclusive.

byline.description: If the user or organization should be credited in the byline.

paid_subscribers_only.title: Paid Subscribers Only
paid_subscribers_only.description: Set to true to only make this article available for subscribers to a paid subscription tier in the organization.

paid_subscribers_only_ends_at.title: Paid Subscribers Only Ends At
paid_subscribers_only_ends_at.description: If specified, time at which the article should no longer be restricted to paid subscribers. Only relevant if `paid_subscribers_only` is true.

published_at.title: Published At
published_at.description: Time of publishing. If this date is in the future, the post will be scheduled to publish at this time.

notify_subscribers.title: Notify Subscribers
notify_subscribers.description: Set to true to deliver this article via email and/or notifications to subscribers.

is_pinned.title: Is Pinned
is_pinned.description: If the article should be pinned

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Last modification timestamp of the object.

refunded_at.title: Refunded At
refunded_at.description: If and when the pledge was refunded to the pledger

scheduled_payout_at.title: Scheduled Payout At
scheduled_payout_at.description: When the payout is scheduled to be made to the maintainers behind the issue. Disputes must be made before this date.

issue.description: The issue that the pledge was made towards

pledger.description: The user or organization that made this pledge

hosted_invoice_url.title: Hosted Invoice Url
hosted_invoice_url.description: URL of invoice for this pledge

authed_can_admin_sender.title: Authed Can Admin Sender
authed_can_admin_sender.description: If the currently authenticated subject can perform admin actions on behalf of the maker of the peldge

authed_can_admin_received.title: Authed Can Admin Received
authed_can_admin_received.description: If the currently authenticated subject can perform admin actions on behalf of the receiver of the peldge

created_by.description: For pledges made by an organization, or on behalf of an organization. This is the user that made the pledge. Only visible for members of said organization.

user.description: The user that received the reward (if any)

BenefitCustom.description:
A benefit of type `custom`.

Use it to grant any kind of benefit that doesn't fit in the other types.

BenefitGitHubRepository.title: BenefitGitHubRepository
BenefitGitHubRepository.description:
A benefit of type `github_repository`.

Use it to automatically invite your backers to a private GitHub repository.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the benefit. Will be displayed on products having this benefit.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The ID of the organization owning the benefit. **Required unless you use an organization token.**

permission.title: Permission
permission.description: The permission level to grant. Read more about roles and their permissions on [GitHub documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/organizations/managing-user-access-to-your-organizations-repositories/managing-repository-roles/repository-roles-for-an-organization#permissions-for-each-role).

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description:
Key-value object allowing you to store additional information.

The key must be a string with a maximum length of **40 characters**.
The value must be a string with a maximum length of **500 characters**.
You can store up to **50 key-value pairs**.

anyOf.description: IP address of the customer. Used to detect tax location.

success_url.title: Success Url
success_url.description: URL where the customer will be redirected after a successful payment.You can add the `checkout_id={CHECKOUT_ID}` query parameter to retrieve the checkout session id.

CheckoutUpdate.title: CheckoutUpdate
CheckoutUpdate.description: Update an existing checkout session using an access token.

anyOf.description: Amount to pay in cents. Only useful for custom prices, it'll be ignored for fixed and free prices.

CheckoutUpdatePublic.description: Update an existing checkout session using the client secret.

is_archived.title: Is Archived
is_archived.description: Whether the product is archived. If `true`, the product won't be available for purchase anymore. Existing customers will still have access to their benefits, and subscriptions will continue normally.

prices.description: List of available prices for this product. If you want to keep existing prices, include them in the list as an `ExistingProductPrice` object.

modified_at.description: Last modification timestamp of the object.

last_http_code.title: Last Http Code
last_http_code.description: Last HTTP code returned by the URL. `null` if no delviery has been attempted or if the endpoint was unreachable.

succeeded.title: Succeeded
succeeded.description: Whether this event was successfully delivered. `null` if no delivery has been attempted.

payload.title: Payload
payload.description: The payload of the webhook event.

WebhookEvent.title: WebhookEvent
WebhookEvent.description:
A webhook event.

An event represent something that happened in the system
that should be sent to the webhook endpoint.

It can be delivered multiple times until it's marked as succeeded,
each one creating a new delivery.

WebhookOrderCreatedPayload.title: WebhookOrderCreatedPayload
WebhookOrderCreatedPayload.description:
Sent when a new order is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Full

WebhookOrganizationUpdatedPayload.title: WebhookOrganizationUpdatedPayload
WebhookOrganizationUpdatedPayload.description:
Sent when a organization is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

WebhookPledgeCreatedPayload.title: WebhookPledgeCreatedPayload
WebhookPledgeCreatedPayload.description:
Sent when a new pledge is created. Note that this does mean that the pledge has been paid yet.

**Discord & Slack support:** Full

WebhookPledgeUpdatedPayload.title: WebhookPledgeUpdatedPayload
WebhookPledgeUpdatedPayload.description:
Sent when a pledge is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

WebhookProductCreatedPayload.title: WebhookProductCreatedPayload
WebhookProductCreatedPayload.description:
Sent when a new product is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

WebhookProductUpdatedPayload.title: WebhookProductUpdatedPayload
WebhookProductUpdatedPayload.description:
Sent when a product is updated.

**Discord & Slack support:** Basic

WebhookSubscriptionCreatedPayload.title: WebhookSubscriptionCreatedPayload
WebhookSubscriptionCreatedPayload.description:
Sent when a new subscription is created.

**Discord & Slack support:** Full

WebhookSubscriptionUpdatedPayload.title: WebhookSubscriptionUpdatedPayload
WebhookSubscriptionUpdatedPayload.description:
Sent when a new subscription is updated. This event fires if the subscription is cancelled, both immediately and if the subscription is cancelled at the end of the current period.

**Discord & Slack support:** On cancellation

url.title: Url
url.description: URL the customer should be redirected to complete the purchase.

product_price_id.title: Product Price Id
product_price_id.description: ID of the product price to subscribe to.

success_url.title: Success Url
success_url.description: URL where the customer will be redirected after a successful subscription. You can add the `session_id={CHECKOUT_SESSION_ID}` query parameter to retrieve the checkout session id.

customer_email.title: Customer Email
customer_email.description: If you already know the email of your customer, you can set it. It'll be pre-filled on the checkout page.

subscription_id.title: Subscription Id
subscription_id.description: ID of the subscription to update. If not provided, a new subscription will be created.

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Last modification timestamp of the object.

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: Client secret used to update and complete the checkout session from the client.

expires_at.title: Expires At
expires_at.description: Expiration date and time of the checkout session.

success_url.title: Success Url
success_url.description: URL where the customer will be redirected after a successful payment.

anyOf.description: Amount to pay in cents. Only useful for custom prices, it'll be ignored for fixed and free prices.

tax_amount.title: Tax Amount
tax_amount.description: Computed tax amount to pay in cents.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency code of the checkout session.

total_amount.title: Total Amount
total_amount.description: Total amount to pay in cents.

product_id.title: Product Id
product_id.description: ID of the product to checkout.

product_price_id.title: Product Price Id
product_price_id.description: ID of the product price to checkout.

is_payment_required.title: Is Payment Required
is_payment_required.description: Whether the checkout requires payment. Useful to detect free products.

anyOf.description: IP address of the customer. Used to detect tax location.

polar__checkout__schemas__Checkout.title: Checkout
polar__checkout__schemas__Checkout.description: Checkout session data retrieved using an access token.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description:
Key-value object allowing you to store additional information.

The key must be a string with a maximum length of **40 characters**.
The value must be a string with a maximum length of **500 characters**.
You can store up to **50 key-value pairs**.

payment_processor.title: Payment Processor
payment_processor.description: Payment processor to use. Currently only Stripe is supported.

product_price_id.title: Product Price Id
product_price_id.description: ID of the product price to checkout.

anyOf.description: Amount to pay in cents. Only useful for custom prices, it'll be ignored for fixed and free prices.
IP address of the customer. Used to detect tax location.

success_url.title: Success Url
success_url.description: URL where the customer will be redirected after a successful payment.You can add the `checkout_id={CHECKOUT_ID}` query parameter to retrieve the checkout session id.

pat.description: You can generate a **Personal Access Token** from your [settings](https://polar.sh/settings).
